meanings.definition: Make or cause to make a loud, harsh sound.
meanings.sent1: The fire alarm was blaring loudly in the building.
meanings.sent2: The sirens of the police cars were blaring as they rushed to the scene.
meanings.sent3: The blaring music from the party next door kept me up all night.
meanings.sent4: Her anger was like a blaring horn, impossible to ignore.
meanings.sent5: The blaring horn of the ship warned others of its presence in the fog.

meanings.sent1: The blaring of the trumpet signaled the start of the parade.
meanings.sent2: The blaring of the speakers at the concert was almost deafening.
meanings.sent3: The blaring of the car horn startled the pedestrians on the street.
meanings.sent4: The blaring of the alarm clock jolted her awake every morning.
meanings.sent5: The blaring of the fire engine's siren cut through the busy city noise.
